markdownRemark.html:
Learn how to set up Asp.net core project with Visual Studio Code

 

In this post, we will look at how you can get started with Asp.Net Core, build an amaizng site with Visual Studio Code

 

Setting Up Environment

Install .net Core 3.1 SDK from https://dotnet.microsoft.com

Install Visual Studio Cdoe from https://code.visualstudio.com

 

Creating a new project

dotnet new -l

To create an Asp.Net Core WebApplication(MVC)

dotnet new mvc -n yourProjectName

To create an Asp.Net Core Web API

dotnet new webapi -n yourProjectName

 

Setting Up VS CODE for C# Development

Open a project in Visual Studio Code

Install several extensions that you might need for the project

  - C# / C# Extensions / C# FixFormat / C# XML Document

  - .NET Core Extension / .NET Core Tools

  - NuGet Package Manager

 

Testing the first app

dotnet build

dotnet run

 

Add Nuget Package Manager

This is to use DbContext

Open a command line in VS CODE

=> Command + Shift + p

=> Nuget Package Manager: Add Package

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design

 

Install DotNet Entity Framework Tools

dotnet tool install --global dotnet-ef

To see commands

dotnet ef -h

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57066856/dotnet-ef-not-found-in-net-core-3

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41536603/visual-studio-code-entity-framework-core-add-migration-not-recognized

dotnet ef migrations add first

dotnet ef database update

 

Running MySql for the Asp.Net Core

Install a package

https://github.com/PomeloFoundation/Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools.DotNet

 

Adding the Package Manager Console

Issue

.Net Core MVC Page not Refreshing After Changes

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53639969/net-core-mvc-page-not-refreshing-after-changes/57637903#57637903

 Add Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RuntimeCompilation NuGet package to the project  Add the following in Startup.cs    services.AddControlloersWithViews().AddRazorRuntimeCompilation();

frontmatter.title: Start Asp.Net Core with Visual Studio Code
